channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: BrisAsia Festival
item.description:
Sunday, February 18, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Red to celebrate BrisAsia Festival.

BrisAsia Festival returns from 1-18 February 2024 to celebrate Lunar New Year and the Year of the Dragon, a creature that typically embodies the qualities of power, nobleness, leadership, luck, and success. What better way to kick start your year than to connect with culture at BrisAsia Festival, with something on offer for the whole family.

Over three weeks, audiences can experience the transformative power of live performance, learn, and grow through immersive experiences and travel the length and breadth of Asia across the incredibly packed festival program that has something for everyone.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

item.title: Small Steps 4 Hannah
item.description:
Monday, February 19, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit  Pink to support Small Steps 4 Hannah.

In loving memory of Hannah Clarke and her three children, Aaliyah, Laianah and Trey who tragically died two years ago. Their legacy lives on through the Small Steps 4 Hannah Foundation which exists to HALT the cycle of domestic violence so that everyone can feel respected, informed, confident to act, and safe. By taking small steps together, we can achieve giant leaps to HALT domestic violence.

The Foundation will also be running a campaign of 19 days of Handstands - from February 1 - February 19. Hannah and the kids loved handstands and they ask the community to attempt/do a handstand upload to social media and share with us.

This Light Up is organised by: Small Steps 4 Hannah Foundation

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: 2024 Brisbane Lions Season
item.description:
Tuesday, February 20, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue, Yellow and Maroon to celebrate the launch of the 2024 Brisbane Lions Season.

The Brisbane Lions have an important connection with Brisbane City and aim to reach beyond our 50,000 members by lighting up this iconic landmark in our club colours.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Lions Australian Football Club.



Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description: The Story Bridge will be lit Blue, Yellow and Maroon to celebrate the launch of the 2024 Brisbane Lions Season. This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Lions Australian Football Club.
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: World Encephalitis Day
item.description:
Thursday, February 22, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Red to support World Encephalitis Day.

World Encephalitis Day is observed on February 22nd each year. This day is an opportunity to educate the public, healthcare professionals, and policymakers about the importance of early recognition, diagnosis, and treatment of encephalitis.

This Light Up is organised by: Encephalitis International 

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

item.title: Navy Week
item.description:
Friday, February 23, 2024

The Reddacliff Place Sculptures Bridge will be lit Blue to celebrate Navy Week.

Over seven days, the Royal Australian Navy will showcase Navy Week and its importance to the Australian way of life. The Navy will continue to celebrate its tradition and heritage and we encourage all members of the broader community to come along to HMAS Moreton’s base open days, indigenous performance, sporting events, capability demonstrations and community concerts. The week will include Navy celebrating its 123rd birthday. Navy Week is an excellent opportunity for our people who serve, their families and the broader Australian community to come together and recognise the critical role our Navy plays in safeguarding the prosperity of our nation, on and under the sea.

This Light Up is organised by: Royal Australian Navy

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Navy Week - Beat to Quarters and Cermonial Sunset
item.description:
Friday, February 23, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue to celebrate Navy Week - Beat to Quarters and Cermonial Sunset.

Showcasing Navy’s importance to the Australian way of life. The Navy will celebrate its traditions and heritage through a number of events across Brisbane for Navy Week and we encourage all to come along. Join us for Beat to Quarters and Ceremonial Sunset at King George Square (23 Feb).

Beat to Quarters is a tradition dating back to the age of sails. It was the sound of a ships drum that would summon the Sailors to action stations when battle was imminent. Today we keep the beat to quarters tradition going to honour the courage and sacrifice of men and women that have served in the Royal Australian Navy.

This Light Up is organised by: Royal Australian Navy

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:summary: Navy Week - Beat to Quarters and Cermonial Sunset

Beat to Quarters is a tradition dating back to the age of sails. It was the sound of a ships drum that would summon the Sailors to action stations when battle was imminent. Today we keep the beat to quarters tradition going to honour the courage and sacrifice of men and women that have served in the Royal Australian Navy.

item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: BMX World Racing Cup
item.description:
Saturday, February 24, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Green and Gold to support BMX World Racing Cup.

The world's hottest BMX racing series is coming to Brisbane in 2024! See the best BMX riders on the planet go head-to-head over two days of competition at Brisbane SX International BMX Centre, part of the Sleeman Sports Centre, at the world class BMX track.

The event is part of the key qualification pathway to the Paris 2024 Olympic Games and is the same venue that will host the BMX Racing World Championships in 2026 and the Olympic Games BMX Racing in 2032. The racing categories consist of Elite Men and Women, and Men and Women Under 23.

Be sure to wear the green and gold as you cheer on our Aussie riders as they take on the World’s best!

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

The world's hottest BMX racing series is coming to Brisbane in 2024! See the best BMX riders on the planet go head-to-head over two days of competition at Brisbane SX International BMX Centre, part of the Sleeman Sports Centre, at the world class BMX track.
The event is part of the key qualification pathway to the Paris 2024 Olympic Games and is the same venue that will host the BMX Racing World Championships in 2026 and the Olympic Games BMX Racing in 2032. The racing categories consist of Elite Men and Women, and Men and Women Under 23.

item.title: The Eve of Rare Disease Day
item.description:
Wednesday, February 28, 2024

The Reddacliff Place Sculptures will be lit Blue to support The Eve of Rare Disease Day.

Rare Disease Day is held on the last day of February – this year on Feb 29th, It is the globally coordinated movement for rare diseases, working towards equity in social opportunity, healthcare, and access to diagnosis and therapies for people living with a rare disease.

This Light Up is organised by: Rare Voices Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

This Light Up is organised by: Rare Voices Australia

item.title: The Eve of Red Bow Day
item.description:
Thursday, February 29, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple and Red to support The Eve of Red Bow Day.

Muscular Dystrophy Queensland supports people living with muscle wasting conditions, so that they can make the most of opportunities and live the lives they choose. Red Bow Day is one of our most important appeals for raising awareness for and funds to support people living with muscle wasting conditions.

This Light Up is organised by: Muscular Dystrophy Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

Red Bow Day is one of our most important appeals for raising awareness for and funds to support people living with muscle wasting conditions.
This Light Up is organised by: Muscular Dystrophy Queensland
